intro: Caladium houlletii, commonly known as the "Easter lily" or "white caladium," is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically white with red veins, creating a striking visual contrast. The plant is a member of the Araceae family, which includes other ornamental plants like peace lilies and philodendrons. Caladium houlletii thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is often cultivated as a decorative foliage plant in gardens and indoor spaces due to its vibrant, showy leaves.
